page.title: 12Tytherley Village School
page.content: Records of the village school date back into the 19th.Century.From being an all-age school it has become a primary for pupils aged 4 to 11.Its official designation is{West Tytherley {Church of England (Controlled)Primary {School.} It is controlled by the Hampshire Education Authority but has pupils from Wiltshire and Hampshire. Thus pupils leave for Comprehensive Schools(Hampshire) and Selective Schools(Wiltshire).The school is one of very few taking 11+selection tests for Grammar School Education(Salisbury Grammar Schools).Four pupils have been selected this year(1985).The school role is 63(Summer Term)with a tendency to fall as local housing is expensive for young families and no new building is permitted.Teaching staff is Head Mr.R.J.Hughes plus 2.2 teachers.
